intro: Conospermum boreale, commonly known as the southern snowflakes, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with narrow, leathery leaves. It is well adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate drought conditions, making it a hardy species in its native habitat. The flowers are often visited by birds and insects, contributing to its ecological importance in local ecosystems.
